5 Ways to Clear Cache and Cookies - wikiHow 
 Home Random Browse Articles Add to This Page Add Tip Easy Ways to Help Approve Questions Review Tech Feedback Fix Spelling More Things to Try...   
 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Talk How to Clear Cache and Cookies   
 Maintaining your browser's cache and cookie collection can be convenient, since these are the items that determine which passwords are remembered and which sites pop up in your URL bar the quickest; however, not clearing your cache and cookies can lead to serious security issues (as well as slightly less serious dips in browsing speed). Luckily for both your patience level and your privacy, you can clear the cache and cookies on all major browsers, including the iOS and Android default mobile browsers. 
 Steps Edit 
 Method One of Five: Using Google Chrome Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/de\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/de\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open Google Chrome.  If you use Chrome often, you may notice some slow-down in your browser's processing speed; clearing the cookies and cache will amend that issue.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/ba\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/ba\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click the three vertical dots in the top right corner of your screen.  This will prompt a drop-down menu.
 On the Chrome mobile app, this menu is labeled "More". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9e\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9e\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Hover over the "More Tools" section.  This will open another menu, complete with options for deleting your browser's data.
 On mobile, you'll tap the "History" option here. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3b\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-4-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3b\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-4-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click "Clear browsing data".  This will take you to your "History" page from which you can delete your browsing data.
 You can also hold down  Ctrl  (or  ⌘  Command  on a Mac) +  ⇧  Shift  and tap  Delete  to access this page. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-5-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/3a\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-5-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Make sure all relevant boxes are checked.  At the very least, you'll want to select "Cached images and files" and "Cookies and other site and plugin data".
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fd\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-6-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fd\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-6-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Click the time span menu.  This is next to the "Obliterate the following items from:" text; you can select how far back your data purge goes with this option.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/22\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-7-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/22\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-7-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Select your time span.  You have a range of options:
 The past hour 
 The past day 
 The past week 
 The past 4 weeks 
 The beginning of time 
 If you want to clear your entire cache and reset all of your data, make sure "The beginning of time" is selected. [1] 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d5\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-8-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d5\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-8-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Click "Clear browsing data".  This will wipe your selected criteria from whichever time span you chose off of your browser's History page!
 Advertisement 
 Method Two of Five: Using Mozilla Firefox Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b8\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open Mozilla Firefox.  Frequent Firefox usage will lead to a build-up in your cached pages, images, and cookies. Clearing these will reset your browser's memory, thereby increasing your browsing speed.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8a\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-10-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8a\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-10-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click the menu button in the top right corner of your screen.  This icon resembles three horizontal lines; clicking it will prompt a drop-down menu.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2c\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-11-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2c\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-11-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Click the "Advanced" option.  You'll find this in the menu on the left side of the screen.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-12-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b8\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-12-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click the "Network" tab.  This is located in the middle of the toolbar beneath the "Advanced" heading. [2] 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/89\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-13-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/89\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-13-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Click "Clear Now" on the right side of your screen.  This will clear your cache!
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-14-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bb\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-14-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Return to the Firefox menu.  This is the stack of lines in the top right corner of your page.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bd\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-15-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bd\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-15-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Click the "History" option, then click "Clear Recent History".  This will take you to your "History" page, from which you can clear all of your cookies. [3] 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c0\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-16-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c0\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-16-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Select a time frame.  This is the menu at the top of the "Clear Recent History" page next to the "Time range to clear:" text. For best results, select the "Everything" time range.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cc\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-17-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/cc\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-17-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 9 
 Select "Cookies" in the checkbox menu.  With this option checked, you'll delete all of your browser's cookies. You can check other options as well:
 Browsing & Download History 
 Form & Search History 
 Active Logins (clear this if you're on a shared computer) 
 Site Preferences 
 You can also select "Cache" here for good measure; there's always a chance that your initial flush didn't get everything. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/ff\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-18-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-18-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-18-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 10 
 Click "Clear Now" at the bottom of the page.  This will delete all of your cookies and clean up any remnants of your cache!
 Advertisement 
 Method Three of Five: Using Safari Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c2\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-19-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-19-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c2\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-19-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open Safari.  Safari is no longer supported on Windows platforms, but the Mac version is constantly updated to ensure optimal performance. Clearing your cookies and cache will only boost this performance.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9c\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-20-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-20-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9c\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-20-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click your "Safari" menu in the top left corner of your screen.  This will prompt a drop-down menu.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ac\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-21-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-21-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/ac\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-21-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Click the "Preferences" option.  This will open a window from which you can alter your privacy settings. [4] 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/34\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-22-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-22-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/34\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-22-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click the "Privacy" tab.  This should be near the top of the "Preferences" window. From here, you can clear your cache and cookies. [5] 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/6e\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-23-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/6e\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-23-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Click "Remove All Website Data".  Safari will ask you to confirm your decision.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1e\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-24-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-24-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/1e\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-24-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Click "Remove Now" to confirm your decision.  This will clear both your cookies and your site cache; if you haven't done this before, you should notice a difference in your browsing speed!
 You may have to exit out of Safari and re-open it in order for your changes to take place. 
 Advertisement 
 Method Four of Five: Using iOS Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7c\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-25.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-25.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7c\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-25.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open your default Safari app.  If you're using a browser other than Safari on your iOS device, this method probably won't work.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/37\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-26.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-26.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/37\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-26.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Tap the book icon at the bottom of the page.  This will bring up the last section of the "Bookmarks" menu you had open.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/38\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-27.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-27.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/38\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-27.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Tap the "Bookmarks" tap in the top left corner of your screen.  If you're already on the "Bookmarks" page, ignore this step.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7c\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-28.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-28.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7c\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-28.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Tap the "History" tab.  This will take you to your browsing history page.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bf\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-29.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-29.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bf\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-29.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Tap "Clear" in the bottom right corner of your screen.  Safari will ask you for a duration:
 The last hour 
 Today 
 Today and yesterday 
 All time (select this for best results) 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c5\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-30.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-30.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c5\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-30.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Tap your preferred duration.  This will clear your iOS device's cookies and website cache!
 For best results, close Safari and then re-open it to continue browsing. 
 Advertisement 
 Method Five of Five: Using Android Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/33\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-31.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-31.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/33\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-31.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open your Android's default browser app.  If you're using a browser other than the built-in browsing app, this method likely won't work.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0f\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-32.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-32.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0f\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-32.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Tap the "Menu" button.  This will open a menu within your browser.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-33.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-33.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bc\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-33.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Tap "Settings".  This should be at the bottom of the "More" menu. [6] 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d5\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-34.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-34.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d5\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-34.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Tap "Clear All".  This is toward the bottom of the Settings menu beneath the "Privacy" subheading. Tapping this option will clear both your cache and your cookies.
 You can also tap "Clear Cache" to clear just the cache, but this option won't delete your cookies. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/68\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-35.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-35.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/68\/Clear-Cache-and-Cookies-Step-35.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Tap "OK" when prompted.  Your cache and cookies have been cleared!
 For best results, exit your phone's browser and re-open it after doing this.

 Tips Edit 
 Clear the cache and cookies from your Internet browser if using a public computer. 
 0

 Warnings Edit 
 Resetting your cookies and your cache will erase your saved passwords and usernames.
